Migrate availability response status fields to Alma

comments.body:
It looks like the `process_type` (Process Type for acquisition) values available for our installation are are:

```
ACQ,                        "Acquisition"
CLAIM_RETURNED_LOAN,        "Claimed Returned"
HOLDSHELF,                  "Hold Shelf"
ILL,                        "Resource Sharing Request"
LOAN,                       "Loan"
LOST_ILL,                   "Lost Resource Sharing Item"
LOST_LOAN,                  "Lost"
LOST_LOAN_AND_PAID,         "Lost and paid"
MISSING,                    "Missing"
TECHNICAL,                  "Technical - Migration"
REQUESTED,                  "Requested"
TRANSIT,                    "Transit"
TRANSIT_TO_REMOTE_STORAGE,  "In Transit to Remote Storage"
WORK_ORDER_DEPARTMENT,      "In Process"
```

Fetched via https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/conf/code-tables/PROCESSTYPE?apikey=enter-your-key
@mzelesky Do you think the logic is: If `process_type` is `WORK_ORDER_DEPARTMENT` use the `work_order_type` as the `status` otherwise use `process_type` as the `status`?

bibdata.title: Manage SCSB Update/Delete files via S3

comments.body:
Per @christinach for submitCollection we still have to the following

1 Setting up the S3 connection in the RecapDump job
2. run the job with a timestamp going back to February 17th
3. resume the daily cron job.

@kevinreiss I'm referencing https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1049#issue-801651985 because I describe it in the comment. `The cron job is currently paused and can be resumed to upload from current production Princeton records to SCSB when the AWS connection to SCSB is set and tested (#909 Third checkbox 'Upload Daily Princeton Update Records (SCSB's "SubmitCollection" API)'). As of today 03-10-2021, data were last updated manually by @mzelesky on February 17th; with that said, the job should also run with a timestamp of 02-17-2021 to upload the Princeton records starting 02-17-2021 until the time we resume the job again.`

dpul.title: Add date range rendering to show pages

dspace-development.title: Updating submission forms to reflect industry standards
Create list of empty bitstream filenames

comments.body:
This was quite the investigation!

The query
`select * from metadatavalue where resource_type_id = 0 and text_value IS NULL;`
returned no results for both the staging and dev server.

The query  `select * from metadatavalue where resource_type_id = 0 and text_value = '';` showed 1 result on the staging server, and 0 results on the dev server. Lynn corrected this entry. ([Staging](https://dataspace-staging.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp01c821gn25b), [Dev](https://dataspace-dev.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp01c821gn25b))

Working backwards from the example provided revealed that the problem wasn’t filenames that were NULL, but bitstreams that didn’t have a `dc.title` field, which is `resource_id` 64. **On the prod server there are 619 items that fall in this category.** They've been placed into this google sheet: 
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LhDt9ppgX_Q3uCqKhr3HZieLq12-Up1DlmQW5JrjxF8/edit?usp=sharing

Here is the query:
```sql
SELECT handle,bitstream_id
FROM handle 
INNER JOIN item ON (item.item_id = handle.resource_id)
INNER JOIN item2bundle ON (item.item_id = item2bundle.item_id)
INNER JOIN bundle2bitstream ON (item2bundle.bundle_id = bundle2bitstream.bundle_id)
WHERE bitstream_id IN (
     SELECT resource_id
     FROM metadatavalue WHERE resource_type_id = 0 
     GROUP BY resource_id 
     HAVING NOT (64 = ANY(ARRAY_AGG(metadata_field_id)))
);
```

I'm moving away from this for now, but I would imagine we might want to figure out what our next steps are? I can include collection / community information so that we know what's exclusively Lynn's concern? Some of the metadata includes import information, from which we can grab filenames, so fixing this may be automatable. 

Side note: There were 635 on dev, 20 on staging, and (as mentioned above) 619 on prod. How exactly are dataspace databases being synced?

comments.body: Closing this ticket — the object was a MVW where the parent rights statement was changed, but the volumes still had the old rights statement.

figgy.title: As a figgy ephemera project owner, I would like to download a CSV of all folders in my project, including those that are boxless

comments.body:
I think you can fix this by changing reports_controller.rb#8 to
``` ruby
@resources = @ephemera_project.boxes.map(&:folders).flatten + @ephemera_project.folders
```

figgy.title: Expand fields included in ephemera metadata export

comments.body: See also  https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/issues/4431

I think you could include the folders this way:
``` ruby
@resources = @ephemera_project.boxes.map(&:folders).flatten + @ephemera_project.folders
```

figgy.title: Stakeholder wants Geniza fragments consolidated into multivolume works
Should we change grayscale pdf download selection to color download selection on items in figgy?

comments.body: Some things are set to grayscale because the PDF generates faster and is smaller. Is this a request to bulk change some to color?
@tpendragon yes. some (like illuminated manuscripts) may be identified as needing color for the lot of a specific figgy collection. if that became a request, would it be a large one for DRDS?
Nah, one off bulk edits would be pretty easy.
Whoot! Ok. good to know! Thanks and closing :)

orangelight.title: Fully enable lando and remove solr wrapper
Enable call number csv spec to run with lando
Disable umlaut integration when using Alma

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/37826043/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/37826043)

Coverage remained the same at 96.589% when pulling **514b17119b963a1bf50f6707a87ce464f0dfe23e on 2273-replace-umlaut** into **2afb63a36f0112a9ccabcca292f570b746f1513b on main**.

## account_controller#index

First fetches patron "first_name", "last_name", "barcode" from bibdata using the netit.

Then it hits voyager to get the account object with the following properties:
- avail_items has keys:
  - itemID
  - itemTitle
  - expireDate
  - pickuplocation
- request_items has keys:
  - itemID
  - itemTitle
  - expireDate
  - pickuplocation
  - queuePosition
- fines_fees has keys:
  - date
  - title
  - postingType
  - amount
  - balance
- charged_items has keys:
  - itemId
  - renewable
  - title
  - dueDate
- borrowing_blocks has keys:
  - patronGroupName
  - blockCount
  - blockReason
- demerits renders all keys / values; sample data has keys:
  - demeritId
  - demeritDate
  - itemTitle
  - demeritType
  - amount
  - amountTotal
  - balance
  - balanceTotal

Block info needs to be added to the bibdata response so it can be pulled from the patron without an additional API call. Block data from alma looks like

```
      "user_block": [
        {
          "segment_type": "Internal",
          "block_type": {
            "value": "LOAN"
          },
          "block_description": {
            "value": "CONSORTIA"
          },
          "block_status": "string",
          "block_note": "string",
          "created_by": "string",
          "created_date": "2024-05-30T09:30:10Z",
          "expiry_date": "2019-12-18T14:36:48.659Z"
        }
      ],
```

How does this map onto our current values?

- patronGroupName
- blockCount
- blockReason

Here's some example block data from voyager:
```
            <myac:borrowingBlocks>
                <myac:title>Blocks</myac:title>
                <myac:clusterBorrowingBlocks>
                    <myac:cluster>
                        <myac:clusterName>Princeton University Library</myac:clusterName>
                        <myac:ubSiteId>1@PRINCETONDB20050302104001</myac:ubSiteId>
                    </myac:cluster>
                    <myac:borrowingBlock>
                        <myac:blockReason>odue_recall_limit_patron</myac:blockReason>
                        <myac:blockCount>1</myac:blockCount>
                        <myac:blockCode>21</myac:blockCode>
                        <myac:blockLimit>1</myac:blockLimit>
                        <myac:itemType xsi:nil="true" />
                        <myac:pendingHoldCount xsi:nil="true" />
                        <myac:patronGroupName>Faculty and Professional Staff</myac:patronGroupName>
                    </myac:borrowingBlock>
                </myac:clusterBorrowingBlocks>
            </myac:borrowingBlocks>
```

I don't see demerits in alma at all. Will we still have demerits?

a voyager demerit:
```
        <myac:demerit>
          <myac:demeritId>2997</myac:demeritId>
          <myac:demeritDate>2007-12-05T22:32:54.000Z</myac:demeritDate>
          <myac:itemTitle>Guard of honor.</myac:itemTitle>
          <myac:demeritType>Accrued Demerit</myac:demeritType>
          <myac:amount>50.00</myac:amount>
          <myac:amountTotal>50.00</myac:amountTotal>
          <myac:balance>50.00</myac:balance>
          <myac:balanceTotal>50.00</myac:balanceTotal>
        </myac:demerit>
```

`avail_items` and `request_items` I think would both come from the [user requests GET endpoint](https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/users/R0VUIC9hbG1hd3MvdjEvdXNlcnMve3VzZXJfaWR9L3JlcXVlc3Rz/).

Data coming back looks like:
https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_user_requests.xsd/?tags=GET

- `itemID`: we get a holding_id will that work? This is for using to cancel the request. Maybe there is a request id.
- `itemTitle`: chapter_or_article_title
- `expireDate`: not given? we get last_interest_date, booking_start_date, and booking_end_date. Not sure if any of those are relevant here
- `pickuplocation`: pickup_location_library and pickup_location_circulation_desk
- `queuePosition`: not given. I do see it in the alma patron UI. Is there another way to get this? Probably can just not display this anymore.

charged_items will come from the [user loans get endpoint](https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/users/R0VUIC9hbG1hd3MvdjEvdXNlcnMve3VzZXJfaWR9L2xvYW5z/)

use expand=renewable to get renewable value.

[loans object](https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_item_loans.xsd?tags=GET)

[loan object](https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_item_loan.xsd/)

looks like these will need to be filtered for active loans (see `loan_status`) value of loan object.

- `itemId`: we get barcode, mms_id, holding_id, item_id. Is item_id what we want? This value will be used for renewal; figure out what the renew endpoint uses.
- `renewable`:  renewable
- `title`: title
- `dueDate`: due_date

fines_fees will come from the [user fines endpoint](https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/users/R0VUIC9hbG1hd3MvdjEvdXNlcnMve3VzZXJfaWR9L2ZlZXM=/). Returns active fees by default. Is that what we want?

[fees object](https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_fees.xsd/?tags=GET)

[fee object](https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_fee.xsd/)

- `date`: creation_time
- `title`: title
- `postingType`: type description (but from the example it looks like the api only sends the type value? maybe we can ask them to add the description)
- `amount`: original_amount
- `balance`: balance

Yes, active fees would be what we want to display. We didn't have the option to display past fees in Voyager so that would be new functionality that could potentially added to allow users to see their paid/cancelled fines.

https://github.com/tulibraries/alma_rb/blob/main/lib/alma/user.rb#L9 this `expand` option is making me think there's an undocumented option on https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/users/R0VUIC9hbG1hd3MvdjEvdXNlcnM=/ to get everything we need in 1 call. If so we'd pull it through the bibdata endpoint.

update: that expand only gives the total numbers / amounts.

pulfalight.title: Biographical/historical notes do not always appear in finding aids

comments.body:
@faithc 

Oh wow, this is pretty bad UX in aspace. I'm sure it has a reason, but yeah.

Okay, so it's a user entry issue that I also would have done. The agent for C1667 has a bioghist note which is published, but the sub note (which has the actual content), is NOT published. If you edit the agent and check that box it should reindex with the bioghist.

![Screen Shot 2021-03-09 at 2 56 44 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2806645/110549963-b5c02000-80e7-11eb-90aa-fb6a4f0586b5.png)
Oh wow, that's ridiculous...Thanks for investigating, Trey!
@faithc Can I close this?
Sure. Thanks again for figuring out what the issue is. And now I'm mad at ASpace...haha
